snippet.textDisplay: Daniel Licht, was a talented composer, who unfortunately was not very recognized for being in video games and series very Undervalued by the community, but his songs was very good, a pity to hear that this great composer died on August 4, 2017 because Of the cancer, many may not care about this but since I listen to several of his songs I became his fan, a pity that the community of Silent Hill has been very forgotten to be in the silent hill considered the black sheep of the saga and never Was up to the legend Akira Yamaoka, but did a very good job I have to admit

snippet.textDisplay: Anyone care to tell me what that string instrument is in there? Not the guitar, the high-pitched one. It's in a lot of Silent Hill songs, and I'm curious, because it's a really iconic sound.
snippet.textOriginal: Anyone care to tell me what that string instrument is in there? Not the guitar, the high-pitched one. It's in a lot of Silent Hill songs, and I'm curious, because it's a really iconic sound.

snippet.textDisplay: The one with a lot of tremolo when it's played? My guess is that it's a mandolin or something similar.
snippet.textOriginal: The one with a lot of tremolo when it's played? My guess is that it's a mandolin or something similar.

snippet.textDisplay: True silent hill fans shouldn't bitch about how nothing compares to 2 and all the original 4 are the best. Be open to change you know? That being said I did dislike homecoming and shattered memories, but I loved the story and the atmosphere in Downpour. I do think it would be nice to see the next game have a solid footing in every aspect like the originals BUT I'm not saying it necessarily has to go back to exactly how the first 4 were.
snippet.textOriginal: True silent hill fans shouldn't bitch about how nothing compares to 2 and all the original 4 are the best. Be open to change you know? That being said I did dislike homecoming and shattered memories, but I loved the story and the atmosphere in Downpour. I do think it would be nice to see the next game have a solid footing in every aspect like the originals BUT I'm not saying it necessarily has to go back to exactly how the first 4 were.

snippet.textDisplay: @Odiekun I agree... They just like to feel superior because they've apparently played the classic games.

snippet.textDisplay: @Harris iqbal People bitching about Pyramid Head drives me nuts. Spoilers abound, but if Pyramid Head is meant to serve as James' guilt for killing his wife, then why shouldn't he serve as Alex's guilt for killing his brother? They both killed someone they love, and they both feel so remorseful about it they repress the actual memory of doing it. Whether or not Pyramid Head's inclusion was mega fan service, he still fits in the lore of Homecoming's story.
snippet.textOriginal: @Harris iqbal People bitching about Pyramid Head drives me nuts. Spoilers abound, but if Pyramid Head is meant to serve as James' guilt for killing his wife, then why shouldn't he serve as Alex's guilt for killing his brother? They both killed someone they love, and they both feel so remorseful about it they repress the actual memory of doing it. Whether or not Pyramid Head's inclusion was mega fan service, he still fits in the lore of Homecoming's story.

snippet.textDisplay:
True fans will like every main Silent Hill game... why ? Because they all had this fresh experience to offer... 

There really hasn't been a bad SH game really... (Book of memories doesn't exist!)

In fact, I was just playing through Homecoming too, and man, I can't explain enough how important it was to the expansion of the Silent Hill lore. The game was so good, with great combat and a really sad and heartbreaking story! Alex is a nicely written character!

One thing people can’t stop complaining about is how it featured Pyramid Head. I would like to ask “these” fans if they have ever taken their time to actually follow the original director’s vision on it. Basically, Pyramid head isn’t only unique to James from Silent Hill 2, but is instead the universal symbol for punishment in Silent Hill. You had even seen dark world paintings of it in Silent Hill origins, so how could it be unique to only one game?

Anyways, the story was really beautiful in this game, and it had a really good cover art as well. Also, the history of Shepherd’s Glenn was really interconnected with the Silent Hill history, and had details filled in every corner. This was not a bad Silent Hill game, Book of Memories is a bad Silent Hill game… this was a great Silent Hill

One thing people can’t stop complaining about is how it featured Pyramid Head. snippet.textDisplay: I love all horror games and especially the Silent Hill games even though the stories in them are borderline retarded and the combat wonky and clumsy.  I love them for their atmosphere and vibe though.  Never can get enough of that.  I haven't had a chance to get Origins,Shattered Memories or Downpour yet though. I will find them in a pawn shop for 4 bucks eventually.

snippet.textDisplay: The top comment will probably be something like "No this is dumb bring Akira back" since people are unwilling to let go.  Dan Licht did a great job, and be careful about calling him a replacement since the old team has been willing to still work with him.  Mary McGlyn even did some vocal tracks for the upcoming Vita game.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm sad Yamaoka isn't working on Silent Hill anymore, but I have to give credit for finding a nice replacement in Daniel Licht (notably responsible for the soundtrack in Dexter). This particular theme is very nice. I've always enjoyed the SH games for some reason, there's just something about that series I enjoy, including those last few ones. I'm looking forward to playing Downpour.
